questions.question: 1. How can we estimate the rate of the reaction between potassium iodide and sodium thiosulphate, in the presence of hydrogen peroxide, using a starch solution as indicator?

answers.a: From the volume of distilled water.
answers.b: From the volume of starch solution
answers.c: By measuring the time taken for the formation of iodide ions.
answers.d: By measuring the time taken for the appearance of blue colour.

questions.question: 2.In which reaction does the following composition give a blue coloration? ?

answers.a: KI, H₂SO₄, Na₂S₂O₃, Starch solution, Hydrogen peroxide, Distilled water
answers.b: KI, Starch solution, Na₂S₂O₃, Hydrogen peroxide, Distilled water
answers.d: KI, Starch solution, Na₂S₂O₃, Hydrogen peroxide.

questions.question: 3. Which one of the following acids is used to make the medium acidic in the reaction between potassium iodide and sodium thiosulphate, in the presence of hydrogen peroxide?
4. What is the nature of the graph obtained by plotting Time for the appearance of blue colour Vs 1/volume of KI?
5.Consider the reaction R→P. Which of the following expresses the rate of the reaction?
